DD_Attribute.name: apparent_visual_magnitude
DD_Attribute.definition: The estimated magnitude at the time of observation as seen by the eye, or unfiltered observations.

DD_Attribute.name: airmass
DD_Attribute.definition: Amount of air along the line of sight when observing a celestial target. Equivalent to one divided by the cosine of the zenith angle (in degrees).

DD_Attribute.name: photometric
DD_Attribute.definition: The photometric attribute specifies whether observations at the time were considered photometric by the observer.

DD_Attribute.name: observing_notes
DD_Attribute.definition: The observing_notes attribute is an optional field for describing the quality of the given observations.

DD_Attribute.name: airmass_time
DD_Attribute.definition: The airmass_time attribute specifies the time at which the airmass was measured.

DD_Attribute.name: seeing_full_width_half_maximum
DD_Attribute.definition: This attribute specifies the FWHM of the seeing disk (e.g. a star).

DD_Attribute.name: ambient_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The ambient_temperature attribute specifies the measured outside temperature during the observation.

DD_Attribute.name: ambient_pressure
DD_Attribute.definition: The ambient_pressure attribute specifies the measured outside pressure during the observation.

DD_Attribute.name: ambient_humidity
DD_Attribute.definition: The humidity attribute specifies the measured outside humidity during the observation, given as a percentage.

DD_Attribute.name: ambient_clouds
DD_Attribute.definition: The clouds attribute specifies the measured percentage of clouds present during the observation.

DD_Attribute.name: weather_notes
DD_Attribute.definition: The weather_notes attribute is an optional field for describing the weather during the observation.

DD_Attribute.name: instrument_temperature
DD_Attribute.definition: The instrument_temperature attribute specifies the measured temperature of the instrument.

DD_Attribute.name: name
DD_Attribute.definition: The name attribute provides a word or combination of words by which some feature is known.

DD_Attribute.name: wcs_axes
DD_Attribute.definition: A positive integer recording the number of WCS axes used in an image.

DD_Attribute.name: coordinate_system_equinox
DD_Attribute.definition: Time origin of the coordinate system.

DD_Attribute.name: coordinate_system_celestial_pole_longitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Longitude in the native coordinate system of the system's celestial pole.

DD_Attribute.name: coordinate_system_celestial_pole_latitude
DD_Attribute.definition: Latitude in the native coordinate system of the system's celestial pole.

DD_Attribute.name: axis_index
DD_Attribute.definition: Positive integer identifying which World_Axis is being described.

DD_Attribute.name: coordinate_name
DD_Attribute.definition: Name of the celestial coordinate to which this axis corresponds.

DD_Attribute.name: coordinate_system_projection
DD_Attribute.definition: Name of the coordinate system projection used for this axis.

DD_Permissible_Value.value: Gnomonic with polynomial distortion plus SIP

DD_Attribute.name: world_coordinate_reference_point
DD_Attribute.definition: World coordinate value at the reference point for this axis.

DD_Attribute.name: horizontal_axis
DD_Attribute.definition: The ebt:pixel_axis_index corresponding to the horizontal axis of an image.

DD_Attribute.name: vertical_axis
DD_Attribute.definition: The ebt:pixel_axis_index corresponding to the vertical axis of an image.

DD_Attribute.name: world_axis_index
DD_Attribute.definition: An axis of the world coordinate system used for an image, corresponding to the 'i' in the CDi_j formalism.

DD_Attribute.name: pixel_axis_index
DD_Attribute.definition: An axis of the pixel coordinate frame used for an image, corresponding to the 'j' in the CDi_j formalism.

DD_Attribute.name: element_value
DD_Attribute.definition: The value of the matrix element corresponding to a given set of indices.

DD_Attribute.name: parameter_number
DD_Attribute.definition: Integer between 0 and 99 corresponding to a particular non-linear algorithm used in a PV Distortion Matrix.

DD_Attribute.name: polynomial_order
DD_Attribute.definition: Integer between 2 and 9 corresponding to the order of distortion polynomial in an image using the SIP standard.

DD_Attribute.name: p_polynomial_degree
DD_Attribute.definition: Integer value representing the degree of the polynomial term in a SIP distortion polynomial, the p in, f.e. A_p_q.

DD_Attribute.name: q_polynomial_degree
DD_Attribute.definition: Integer value representing the degree of the polynomial term in a SIP distortion polynomial, the q in, f.e. A_p_q.

DD_Attribute.name: vertical_coordinate_pixel
DD_Attribute.definition: vertical_coordinate_pixel (line) is the vertical coordinate of a specific pixel.

DD_Attribute.name: horizontal_coordinate_pixel
DD_Attribute.definition: horizontal_coordinate_pixel (sample) is the horizontal coordinate of a specific pixel.

DD_Attribute.name: horizontal_pixel_field_of_view
DD_Attribute.definition: The horizontal_pixel_field_of_view provides the angular measure of the horizontal field of view of a single pixel, and is sometimes referred to as the instantaneous field of view. The pixel_field_of_view_method attribute will designate the method used to determine this value. If the pixel_field_of_view_method attribute is not specified, see the camera documentation for more details.

DD_Attribute.name: vertical_pixel_field_of_view
DD_Attribute.definition: The vertical_pixel_field_of_view provides the angular measure of the vertical field of view of a single pixel, and is sometimes referred to as the instantaneous field of view. The pixel_field_of_view_method attribute will designate the method used to determine this value. If the pixel_field_of_view_method attribute is not specified, see the camera documentation for more details.

DD_Attribute.name: pixel_field_of_view_method
DD_Attribute.definition: The pixel_field_of_view_method provides the method used to get the values of the horizontal/vertical_pixel_field_view attributes. If the pixel field of view does not vary across the camera field of view, then this value is 'constant'. If the pixel field of view does vary across the camera field of view, the pixel field of view can be determined either by the center pixel of the camera or the average field of view of the pixel. See the camera documentation for more details.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Pixel field of view does not vary across the camera field of view
Pixel field of view varies across the camera field of view and represents the FOV of the central pixel of the camera
Pixel field of view varies across the camera field of view and represents the average FOV of the pixel

DD_Attribute.name: horizontal_pixel_footprint
DD_Attribute.definition: The horizontal_pixel_footprint provides the the size of the horizontal field of view of a single pixel projected onto the target specified in the parent Geometry_Orbiter class.

DD_Attribute.name: vertical_pixel_footprint
DD_Attribute.definition: The vertical_pixel_footprint provides the size of the vertical field of view of a single pixel projected onto the target specified in the parent Geometry_Orbiter class.

DD_Attribute.name: reference_location
DD_Attribute.definition: The reference_location indicates the position to which values in the containing class apply. If the reference location is on a target, the target is the one specified in the parent Geometry_Orbiter class.

DD_Permissible_Value.value_meaning: Values were determined for the point where the boresight vector intersects the designated target.
Values were determined for the subspacecraft point on the designated target.
Values were determined for the center of the designated target.

DD_Attribute.name: distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The distance attribute provides the scalar distance between to objects or points.

DD_Attribute.name: target_geocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The target_geocentric_distance attribute provides the scalar distance between the center of the target and the center of the Earth.

DD_Attribute.name: minimum_target_geocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The minimum_target_geocentric_distance attribute provides the smallest value for the distance between the center of the target and the center of the Earth during the observation.

DD_Attribute.name: maximum_target_geocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The maximum_target_geocentric_distance attribute provides the largest value for the distance between the center of the target and the center of the Earth during the observation.

DD_Attribute.name: start_target_geocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The start_target_geocentric_distance attribute provides the scalar distance between the center of the target and the center of the Earth at the beginning of the observation (geometry_start_time_utc).

DD_Attribute.name: stop_target_geocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The stop_target_geocentric_distance attribute provides the scalar distance between the center of the target and the center of the Earth at the end of the observation (geometry_stop_time_utc).

DD_Attribute.name: target_heliocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The target_heliocentric_distance attribute provides the scalar distance between the center of the target and the center of the Sun.

DD_Attribute.name: minimum_target_heliocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The minimum_target_heliocentric_distance attribute provides the smallest value for the distance between the center of the target and the center of the Sun during the observation.

DD_Attribute.name: maximum_target_heliocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The maximum_target_heliocentric_distance attribute provides the largest value for the distance between the center of the target and the center of the Sun during the observation.

DD_Attribute.name: start_target_heliocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The start_target_heliocentric_distance attribute provides the scalar distance between the center of the target and the center of the Sun at the beginning of the observation (geometry_start_time_utc).

DD_Attribute.name: stop_target_heliocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The stop_target_heliocentric_distance attribute provides the scalar distance between the center of the target and the center of the Sun at the end of the observation (geometry_stop_time_utc).

DD_Attribute.name: target_ssb_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The target_ssb_distance attribute provides the scalar distance between the center of the target and the Solar System Barycenter.

DD_Attribute.name: minimum_target_ssb_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The minimum_target_ssb_distance attribute provides the smallest value for the distance between the center of the target and the Solar System Barycenter during the observation.

DD_Attribute.name: maximum_target_ssb_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The maximum_target_ssb_distance attribute provides the largest value for the distance between the center of the target and the Solar System Barycenter during the observation.

DD_Attribute.name: start_target_ssb_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The start_target_ssb_distance attribute provides the scalar distance between the center of the target and the Solar System Barycenter at the beginning of the observation (geometry_start_time_utc).

DD_Attribute.name: stop_target_ssb_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The stop_target_ssb_distance attribute provides the scalar distance between the center of the target and the Solar System Barycenter at the end of the observation (geometry_stop_time_utc).

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_target_center_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_target_center_distance attribute provides the scalar distance between the spacecraft and the center of the target specified in the parent Geometry_Orbiter class.

DD_Attribute.name: minimum_spacecraft_target_center_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The minimum_spacecraft_target_center_distance attribute provides the smallest value during the observation for the distance between the spacecraft and the center of the target specified in the parent Geometry_Orbiter class.

DD_Attribute.name: maximum_spacecraft_target_center_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The maximum_spacecraft_target_center_distance attribute provides the largest value during the observation for the distance between the spacecraft and the center of the target specified in the parent Geometry_Orbiter class.

DD_Attribute.name: start_spacecraft_target_center_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The start_spacecraft_target_center_distance attribute provides the scalar distance at the beginning of the observation (geometry_start_time_utc) between the spacecraft and the center of the target specified in the parent Geometry_Orbiter class.

DD_Attribute.name: stop_spacecraft_target_center_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The stop_spacecraft_target_center_distance attribute provides the scalar distance at the end of the observation (geometry_stop_time_utc) between the spacecraft and the center of the target specified in the parent Geometry_Orbiter class.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance attribute provides the scalar distance between the spacecraft and the boresight vector intercept point on the surface of the target specified in the parent Geometry_Orbiter class.

DD_Attribute.name: minimum_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The minimum_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance attribute provides the smallest value during the observation for the distance between the spacecraft and the boresight vector intercept point on the surface of the target specified in the parent Geometry_Orbiter class.

DD_Attribute.name: maximum_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The maximum_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance attribute provides the largest value during the observation for the distance between the spacecraft and the boresight vector intercept point on the surface of the target specified in the parent Geometry_Orbiter class.

DD_Attribute.name: start_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The start_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance attribute provides the scalar distance at the beginning of the observation (geometry_start_time_utc) between the spacecraft and the boresight vector intercept point on the surface of the target specified in the parent Geometry_Orbiter class.

DD_Attribute.name: stop_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The stop_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance attribute provides the scalar distance at the end of the observation (geometry_stop_time_utc) between the spacecraft and the boresight vector intercept point on the surface of the target specified in the parent Geometry_Orbiter class.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance attribute provides the scalar distance between the spacecraft and the subspacecraft point on the surface of the target specified in the parent Geometry_Orbiter class.

DD_Attribute.name: minimum_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The minimum_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance attribute provides the smallest value during the observation for the distance between the spacecraft and the subspacecraft point on the surface of the target specified in the parent Geometry_Orbiter class.

DD_Attribute.name: maximum_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The maximum_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance attribute provides the largest value during the observation for the distance between the spacecraft and the subspacecraft point on the surface of the target specified in the parent Geometry_Orbiter class.

DD_Attribute.name: start_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The start_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance attribute provides the scalar distance at the beginning of the observation (geometry_start_time_utc) between the spacecraft and the subspacecraft point on the surface of the target specified in the parent Geometry_Orbiter class.

DD_Attribute.name: stop_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The stop_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance attribute provides the scalar distance at the end of the observation (geometry_stop_time_utc) between the spacecraft and the subspacecraft point on the surface of the target specified in the parent Geometry_Orbiter class.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_central_body_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_central_body_distance attribute provides the scalar distance between the spacecraft and the center of the central body (e.g., the center of Mars when opperating in the Mars system).

DD_Attribute.name: minimum_spacecraft_central_body_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The minimum_spacecraft_central_body_distance attribute provides the smallest value during the observation for the distance between the spacecraft and the center of the central body (e.g., the center of Mars when opperating in the Mars system).

DD_Attribute.name: maximum_spacecraft_central_body_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The maximum_spacecraft_central_body_distance attribute provides the largest value during the observation for the distance between the spacecraft and the center of the central body (e.g., the center of Mars when opperating in the Mars system).

DD_Attribute.name: start_spacecraft_central_body_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The start_spacecraft_central_body_distance attribute provides the scalar distance at the beginning of the observation (geometry_start_time_utc) between the spacecraft and the center of the central body (e.g., the center of Mars when opperating in the Mars system).

DD_Attribute.name: stop_spacecraft_central_body_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The stop_spacecraft_central_body_distance attribute provides the scalar distance at the end of the observation (geometry_stop_time_utc) between the spacecraft and the center of the central body (e.g., the center of Mars when opperating in the Mars system).

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_geocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_geocentric_distance attribute provides the scalar distance between the spacecraft and the center of Earth.

DD_Attribute.name: minimum_spacecraft_geocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The minimum_spacecraft_geocentric_distance attribute provides the smallest value during the observation for the distance between the spacecraft and the center of Earth.

DD_Attribute.name: maximum_spacecraft_geocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The maximum_spacecraft_geocentric_distance attribute provides the largest value during the observation for the distance between the spacecraft and the center of Earth.

DD_Attribute.name: start_spacecraft_geocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The start_spacecraft_geocentric_distance attribute provides the scalar distance at the beginning of the observation (geometry_start_time_utc) between the spacecraft and the center of Earth.

DD_Attribute.name: stop_spacecraft_geocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The stop_spacecraft_geocentric_distance attribute provides the scalar distance at the end of the observation (geometry_stop_time_utc) between the spacecraft and the center of Earth.

DD_Attribute.name: spacecraft_heliocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The spacecraft_heliocentric_distance attribute provides the scalar distance between the spacecraft and the center of the Sun.

DD_Attribute.name: minimum_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The minimum_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance attribute provides the smallest value during the observation for the distance between the spacecraft and the center of the Sun.

DD_Attribute.name: maximum_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The maximum_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance attribute provides the largest value during the observation for the distance between the spacecraft and the center of the Sun.

DD_Attribute.name: start_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The start_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance attribute provides the scalar distance at the beginning of the observation (geometry_start_time_utc) between the spacecraft and the center of the Sun.

DD_Attribute.name: stop_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance
DD_Attribute.definition: The stop_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance attribute provides the scalar distance at the end of the observation (geometry_stop_time_utc) between the spacecraft and the center of the Sun.

DD_Attribute.name: body_spice_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The body_spice_name attribute is a NAIF-recognized string identifier for a physical object (spacecraft, planet, instrument transmitter, system barycenter, etc.), associated with the data.

DD_Attribute.name: frame_spice_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The frame_spice_name attribute is a NAIF-recognized string identifier for a reference frame associated with the data.

DD_Class.name: Earth_Based_Telescope_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: This class is intended to provide additional metadata for earth-based telescopic observations. Much of the information is geometry information, but in an earth-based context.

DD_Class.name: Telescope_Geometry
DD_Class.definition: The Geometry_Telescope class is a container for geometric information relevant to ground-based observations, as well as observations made from Earth-orbiting telescopes.

DD_Class.name: Instrument_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: This class measures instrument temperatures, along with other potential instrument parameters that may affect the observation.

DD_Class.name: Observing_Conditions
DD_Class.definition: This class details the quality of the product based on observational conditions.

DD_Class.name: World_Coordinate_System
DD_Class.definition: This class contains World Coordinate System (WCS) terms as specified by the FITS standard for the purpose of mapping the pixel coordinate frame of an image onto a celestial frame.

DD_Class.name: Pixel_Dimensions
DD_Class.definition: The Pixel_Dimensions class contains information regarding pixel size.

DD_Class.name: Pixel_Size_Projected
DD_Class.definition: The Pixel_Size_Projected class gives the size, in units of length (e.g., kilometers) of the projection of a pixel onto the surface of the target which is specified in the parent Geometry_Orbiter class. The reference_location attribute is used to identify the specific point on the target.

DD_Class.name: Distances
DD_Class.definition: The Distances class is a container of distance classes.

DD_Class.name: Distances_Specific
DD_Class.definition: The Distances_Specific class is a container class for specific distances defined in this dictionary.

DD_Class.name: Distances_Min_Max
DD_Class.definition: The Distances_Min_Max class is a container class for named distances given as minimum-maximum pairs. For distance, if either the minimum or maximum parameter is given, both must be provided.

DD_Class.name: Distances_Start_Stop
DD_Class.definition: The Distances_Start_Stop class is a container class for named distances given as pairs corresponding to the beginning and end of the observation. For a distance, if either the start or stop parameter is given, both must be provided. If any values from this class are included in the label, the parameters geometry_start_time_utc and geometry_stop_time_utc must be given in the enclosing Geometry_Orbiter class.

DD_Class.name: Distance_Generic
DD_Class.definition: The distance between the two objects, both of which must be specified.

DD_Class.name: Observer_Identification
DD_Class.definition: Within the Geometry dictionary context, an "Observer" is the body on the "from" end of a vector, or other translation through space.

DD_Class.name: Geometry_Target_Identification
DD_Class.definition: The object to which the associated set of geometric parameters are given. Within the Geometry dictionary context, a "Target" is the body on the "to" end of a vector, or other translation through space.

DD_Class.name: Body_Identification_Base
DD_Class.definition: The Body_Identification_Base class provides multiple attributes that can be used to identify a physical object (spacecraft, planet instrument, transmitter, system barycenter, etc.). At least one must be used.

DD_Class.name: Reference_Frame_Parameters
DD_Class.definition: This class contains reference terms that define the WCS axes used in an image.

DD_Class.name: World_Axis
DD_Class.definition: This class contains attributes that describe an individual world axis as used in an image.

DD_Class.name: Reference_Frame_Identification
DD_Class.definition: The Reference_Frame_Identification class is a base class for identifying reference frames. These are frames in the NAIF sense, i.e., three orthogonal axes with a specified orientation, but without a fixed origin.

DD_Class.name: Coordinate_Frame_Transformation_Matrix
DD_Class.definition: Container class for the elements of a linear transformation matrix between the world coordinate frame and the pixel coordinate frame.

DD_Class.name: Pixel_Axes
DD_Class.definition: Class containing attributes that link the value of ebt:pixel_axis_index with the horizontal and vertical axes of an image.

DD_Class.name: Transformation_Element
DD_Class.definition: Class containing the value of an element of a linear transformational matrix between the world_axis_index and pixel_axis_index.

DD_Class.name: PV_Distortion_Matrix
DD_Class.definition: This class contains elements of a distortion matrix.

DD_Class.name: Distortion_Element
DD_Class.definition: This class contains attributes for the axis, parameter, and value of an element in a PV distortion matrix.

DD_Class.name: SIP_Distortion_Terms
DD_Class.definition: This class contains subclasses representing the distortion terms used in the SIP standard.

DD_Class.name: A_ORDER
DD_Class.definition: Representation of the non-linear geometric distortion -- polynomial order of the first world axis.

DD_Class.name: B_ORDER
DD_Class.definition: Representation of the non-linear geometric distortion -- polynomial order of the second world axis.

DD_Class.name: AP_ORDER
DD_Class.definition: Representation of the non-linear geometric distortion -- inverse polynomial order of the first pixel axis.

DD_Class.name: BP_ORDER
DD_Class.definition: Representation of the non-linear geometric distortion -- inverse polynomial order of the second pixel axis.

DD_Class.name: SIP_Element
DD_Class.definition: Class containing the value of an element of a SIP distortion polynomial, with element_value corresponding to the actual coefficient.

DD_Class.name: Airmass
DD_Class.definition: This class describes parameters relevant to the airmass during observations.

DD_Class.name: Seeing
DD_Class.definition: This class describes parameters relevant to the seeing during observations.

DD_Class.name: Weather
DD_Class.definition: This class describes parameters relevant to the weather during observations.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:minimum_spacecraft_geocentric_distance) and not (ebt:maximum_spacecraft_geocentric_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:minimum_spacecraft_geocentric_distance and ebt:maximum_spacecraft_geocentric_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:maximum_spacecraft_geocentric_distance) and not (ebt:minimum_spacecraft_geocentric_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:minimum_spacecraft_geocentric_distance and ebt:maximum_spacecraft_geocentric_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:minimum_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance) and not (ebt:maximum_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:minimum_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance and ebt:maximum_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:maximum_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance) and not (ebt:minimum_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:minimum_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance and ebt:maximum_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:minimum_spacecraft_central_body_distance) and not (ebt:maximum_spacecraft_central_body_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:minimum_spacecraft_central_body_distance and ebt:maximum_spacecraft_central_body_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:maximum_spacecraft_central_body_distance) and not (ebt:minimum_spacecraft_central_body_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:minimum_spacecraft_central_body_distance and ebt:maximum_spacecraft_central_body_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:minimum_spacecraft_target_center_distance) and not (ebt:maximum_spacecraft_target_center_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:minimum_spacecraft_target_center_distance and ebt:maximum_spacecraft_target_center_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:maximum_spacecraft_target_center_distance) and not (ebt:minimum_spacecraft_target_center_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:minimum_spacecraft_target_center_distance and ebt:maximum_spacecraft_target_center_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:minimum_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance) and not (ebt:maximum_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:minimum_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance and ebt:maximum_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:maximum_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance) and not (ebt:minimum_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:minimum_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance and ebt:maximum_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:minimum_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance) and not (ebt:maximum_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:minimum_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance and ebt:maximum_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:maximum_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance) and not (ebt:minimum_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:minimum_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance and ebt:maximum_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:minimum_target_geocentric_distance) and not (ebt:maximum_target_geocentric_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:minimum_target_geocentric_distance and ebt:maximum_target_geocentric_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:maximum_target_geocentric_distance) and not (ebt:minimum_target_geocentric_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:minimum_target_geocentric_distance and ebt:maximum_target_geocentric_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:minimum_target_heliocentric_distance) and not (ebt:maximum_target_heliocentric_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:minimum_target_heliocentric_distance and ebt:maximum_target_heliocentric_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:maximum_target_heliocentric_distance) and not (ebt:minimum_target_heliocentric_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:minimum_target_heliocentric_distance and ebt:maximum_target_heliocentric_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:minimum_target_ssb_distance) and not (ebt:maximum_target_ssb_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:minimum_target_ssb_distance and ebt:maximum_target_ssb_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:maximum_target_ssb_distance) and not (ebt:minimum_target_ssb_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:minimum_target_ssb_distance and ebt:maximum_target_ssb_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: ancestor::ebt:Geometry_Orbiter/ebt:geometry_start_time_utc and ancestor::ebt:Geometry_Orbiter/ebt:geometry_stop_time_utc
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:If you use the Distances_Start_Stop class, you must give values for Geometry_Orbiter/geometry_start_time_utc and Geometry_Orbiter/geometry_stop_time_utc.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:start_spacecraft_geocentric_distance) and not (ebt:stop_spacecraft_geocentric_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:start_spacecraft_geocentric_distance and ebt:stop_spacecraft_geocentric_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:stop_spacecraft_geocentric_distance) and not (ebt:start_spacecraft_geocentric_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:start_spacecraft_geocentric_distance and ebt:stop_spacecraft_geocentric_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:start_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance) and not (ebt:stop_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:start_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance and ebt:stop_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:stop_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance) and not (ebt:start_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:start_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance and ebt:stop_spacecraft_heliocentric_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:start_spacecraft_central_body_distance) and not (ebt:stop_spacecraft_central_body_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:start_spacecraft_central_body_distance and ebt:stop_spacecraft_central_body_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:stop_spacecraft_central_body_distance) and not (ebt:start_spacecraft_central_body_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:start_spacecraft_central_body_distance and ebt:stop_spacecraft_central_body_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:start_spacecraft_target_center_distance) and not (ebt:stop_spacecraft_target_center_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:start_spacecraft_target_center_distance and ebt:stop_spacecraft_target_center_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:stop_spacecraft_target_center_distance) and not (ebt:start_spacecraft_target_center_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:start_spacecraft_target_center_distance and ebt:stop_spacecraft_target_center_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:start_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance) and not (ebt:stop_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:start_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance and ebt:stop_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:stop_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance) and not (ebt:start_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:start_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance and ebt:stop_spacecraft_target_boresight_intercept_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:start_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance) and not (ebt:stop_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:start_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance and ebt:stop_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:stop_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance) and not (ebt:start_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:start_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance and ebt:stop_spacecraft_target_subspacecraft_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:start_target_geocentric_distance) and not (ebt:stop_target_geocentric_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:start_target_geocentric_distance and ebt:stop_target_geocentric_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:stop_target_geocentric_distance) and not (ebt:start_target_geocentric_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:start_target_geocentric_distance and ebt:stop_target_geocentric_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:start_target_heliocentric_distance) and not (ebt:stop_target_heliocentric_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:start_target_heliocentric_distance and ebt:stop_target_heliocentric_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:stop_target_heliocentric_distance) and not (ebt:start_target_heliocentric_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:start_target_heliocentric_distance and ebt:stop_target_heliocentric_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:start_target_ssb_distance) and not (ebt:stop_target_ssb_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:start_target_ssb_distance and ebt:stop_target_ssb_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:stop_target_ssb_distance) and not (ebt:start_target_ssb_distance)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:start_target_ssb_distance and ebt:stop_target_ssb_distance, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:start_time) and not (ebt:stop_time)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:start_time and ebt:stop_time, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:stop_time) and not (ebt:start_time)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: ebt:start_time and ebt:stop_time, are a pair; if you use one, you must use both.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if (not(ebt:body_spice_name) and not (pds:name) and not (pds:Internal_Reference)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: At least one of the following must be present: ebt:body_spice_name, pds:name, pds:Internal_Reference.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: pds:reference_type = 'geometry_to_body'
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: For Internal_Reference in ebt:Observer_Identification, reference_type must equal 'geometry_to_body'

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if (not(ebt:body_spice_name) and not (pds:name) and not (pds:Internal_Reference)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: At least one of the following must be present: ebt:body_spice_name, pds:name, pds:Internal_Reference.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: pds:reference_type = 'geometry_to_body'
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: For Internal_Reference in ebt:Geometry_Target_Identification, reference_type must equal 'geometry_to_body'

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if (not(ebt:frame_spice_name) and not (ebt:name) and not (pds:Internal_Reference)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: At least one of the following must be present: ebt:frame_spice_name, ebt:name, pds:Internal_Reference.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: pds:reference_type = 'geometry_to_reference_frame'
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: For Internal_Reference in ebt:Reference_Frame_Identification, reference_type must equal 'geometry_to_reference_frame'

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: pds:reference_type = 'geometry_to_reference_frame'
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: For Internal_Reference in ebt:Body_Identification_Base, reference_type must equal 'geometry_to_body'

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:Reference_Frame_Parameters/ebt:World_Axis/ebt:coordinate_system_projection = ('Gnomonic with polynomial distortion', 'Gnomonic with polynomial distortion plus SIP')) and not (ebt:PV_Distortion_Matrix)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: If ebt:coordinate_system_projection includes polynomial distortion, you must use the ebt:PV_Distortion_Matrix class.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if ((ebt:Reference_Frame_Parameters/ebt:World_Axis/ebt:coordinate_system_projection = ('Gnomonic plus SIP', 'Gnomonic with polynomial distortion plus SIP')) and not (ebt:SIP_Distortion_Terms)) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: If ebt:coordinate_system_projection includes 'plus SIP', you must use the ebt:SIP_Distortion_Terms class.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: if (ebt:Reference_Frame_Identification/ebt:name = ('GAPPT', 'ICRS') and not(ebt:coordinate_system_equinox/@xsi:nil eq 'true')) then false() else true()
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: If ebt:Reference_Frame_Identification/ebt:name = GAPPT or ICRS, then ebt:coordinate_system_equinox must be nill.

DD_Rule_Statement.rule_test: ebt:wcs_axes = count(ebt:World_Axis)
DD_Rule_Statement.rule_message: The number of ebt:World_Axis elements must match the number found in the ebt:wcs_axes attribute.
